body_content.explanation: an occasion when the sun disappears from view, either completely or partly, while the moon is moving between it and the earth, or when the moon becomes darker while the shadow of the earth moves over it:
examples: Some people believe that a solar/lunar eclipse affects their relationships, energy levels, and mood.
On Wednesday there will be a total/partial eclipse of the sun.

body_content.explanation: a situation in which something becomes less important:
examples: The eclipse of the ruling political party was inevitable.
His remarkable contribution to literature has been too long in eclipse.

body_content.explanation: to make an eclipse of the moon or sun:
examples: The moon will be totally eclipsed at 12.10 p.m.

body_content.explanation: to make another person or thing seem much less important, good, or famous:
examples: The economy has eclipsed all other issues during this election campaign.
